fields.description:
Fixes GUI-1127, depending on which version might also have some accessibility features.
 - Will break a lot of stuff, particularly CSS
 - re-doing CSS anyway, though, for HP branding goodness

Latest stable release of Foundation (at time of writing) is 5.5.1...
https://github.com/zurb/foundation/releases

comments.body: [~kgill] I added a bit more detailed scenarios to "Update Zurb Foundation" acceptance criteria, I used language that any tester will likely understand. Unfortunately one has  to click on "Update Zurb Foundation" link twice to view them.
Foundation compilation issues based on the Sass version are noted at https://github.com/zurb/foundation/issues/5811

Notice the following issues so far after updating to Foundation 5.5.1...

Visual glitches:
- Hamburger-activated top/side nav bar not working [FIXED]
- Gear icons on dashboard have an unwanted border and drop-down caret [FIXED]
- Gear icons on landing pages have an unwanted border and drop-down caret [FIXED]
- Buttons have an unwanted border [FIXED]
- User detail page white background no longer wraps main content (for all tabs) [FIXED]
- Min/desired/max form labels are behind the inputs on the scaling group detail page and create scaling group wizard [FIXED]
- The "Add a scaling policy" tile on the scaling group policy page isn't centered [FIXED]
- The "Attach a volume" tile on the instance volumes page isn't centered [FIXED]
- The "Create a snapshot" tile on the volume snapshots page isn't centered [FIXED]
- There is too much spacing below the labels in the summary section of the wizards [FIXED]
- The select buttons in the image picker in the launch instance and launch config wizards have an unwanted border, color, and text wrapping [FIXED]
- Other primary and secondary buttons have an unwanted border [FIXED]
- There is too little spacing below the form labels on the login and change password pages [FIXED]
- There is too little padding around the form on the login page [FIXED]

Broken features:
- Selecting an image in the create/launch wizard image picker throws a "TypeError: undefined is not a function (evaluating 'a.getAttribute(b)')" error in the JS console
- The list of instances in the Attach volume dialog is missing when dialog is launched from the volumes landing page. [FIXED]
- The IP addresses chosen widget in the Attach IP address dialog on the instance detail page is broken [FIXED]
- The dialogs on the launch instance and create launch config wizards aren't properly reset when subsequently opened. [FIXED]
- The volumes chosen widget in the Attach volume dialog on the instance volumes page is broken. [FIXED]
- The instance selector in the batch terminate dialog on the instances landing page is broken. [FIXED]
- The IP address chosen widget in the Associate IP address dialog on the instances landing page is broken. [FIXED]
- The value in the Allocate IP addresses modal isn't reset to 1 on subsequent openings of the modal. [FIXED]
- The various $scope.setDropdownMenusListener() calls are no longer needed on the landing page and various detail pages to hide the actions dropdown menu when the dialogs are opened. [FIXED]
- The instance list chosen widget in the Attach Volume dialog on the volume detail page is broken. [FIXED]
- Dialogs on various pages don't have the proper focus. [FIXED]
- The initial values aren't properly set in the Create Alarm dialog for scaling group policies. [FIXED]

HEADS UP:
- Foundation 5.5 requires Sass 3.4 and Compass 1.0.  Older versions will return compilation errors using 'compass watch' (and via 'make watch')
- Bower-based installations of Foundation 5.5 include a broken import.  Fixed in https://github.com/zurb/foundation/pull/5836 but subsequently reverted in https://github.com/zurb/foundation/pull/5992 .  Until the fix in 5836 is reinstated, we will need to manually update foundation/_settings.scss to import the functions via @import "functions" rather than @import "foundation/functions" after each Bower-based Foundation install

If that list is complete, then there is only 1 thing actually broken, the rest is visual. Assuming the hamburger is fixable, is the rest reasonable assuming we'd combine fixing them with the HP Helion branding so we only do a major sass change once?
[~dkavanagh]: I'm making decent progress fixing the above issues on the GUI-1478 branch, but I'd like to keep this ticket distinct from GUI-1473 if possible.

Ugh, Foundation has deprecated the un-namespaced modal events as of version 5.4, which explains why the attach volume dialog on the volumes landing page is broken.  See http://foundation.zurb.com/docs/components/reveal.html#event-bindings

Note that the "TypeError: undefined is not a function..." error in the JS console on the launch wizards seems harmless, but I haven't been able to track down the root cause of that notice.  Will open a separate ticket for that after PR 1318 is merged.

[~jloza]: I've submitted PR 1318 for a code review, but feel free to check out the GUI-1478 branch to look for visual discrepancies with what's on master before we merge that PR.  The more eyes we have on this, the better.
[~kgill], [~dkavanagh] How can I check that Foundation was updated in the packages?
Verified foundation version is correct and updated in /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/eucaconsole/static/js/thirdparty/foundation
